Comment: I'm sure there's some lurkers here so I'll probably try to keep this brief.  Not only is this dumb because you shouldn't be damaging other people's personal property, but this person is allegedly opening up a can of worms for Governor Walz because he'll no doubt bare some of the outrage if the accusations are proven to be true.  You can't think about what feels "right" or "fair" when you work in what amounts to a PR role that requires you limit the possibility of damage to your boss's reputation. Your "mistake" becomes something your boss's campaign can inherit.  The damage to privately owned teslas and tesla dealerships strikes me as tantrum behavior and it doesn't make anyone safer or help political platforms.
